Description: Lower body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery neck-amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of quadriga to right (four front legs of pole horses, right pole horse in added white, and right front legs of a trace horse remaining); below, two narrow black bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a parallel see Oxford 1965.119 in CVA 3 (GB14) pl. 38:4.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 241-2, no. B123)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0034) (Phase 1)
